meanings.definition: The state of being forgetful or preoccupied.
meanings.sent1: Her absentmindednesses often led to misplaced keys and forgotten appointments.
meanings.sent2: His absentmindednesses sometimes caused him to walk into a room and forget why he was there.
meanings.sent3: The professor's absentmindednesses were so extreme that he once wore mismatched shoes to class.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of his absentmindednesses, it felt like his thoughts were constantly slipping through his fingers.
meanings.sent5: The absentmindednesses of the old man were as thick as the fog on a misty morning.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being absentminded.
meanings.sent1: The absentmindednesses of the student were evident in his frequent lost homework assignments.
meanings.sent2: She possessed a charming absentmindednesses that made her endearing to those around her.
meanings.sent3: His absentmindednesses reached a peak when he tried to unlock his front door with his car keys.
meanings.sent4: The absentmindednesses of the artist were like brushstrokes of distraction on the canvas of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The absentmindednesses of the professor were as predictable as the ticking of a clock.

meanings.definition: The tendency to forget or be inattentive.
meanings.sent1: His absentmindednesses often resulted in missed deadlines and overlooked details.
meanings.sent2: The absentmindednesses of the receptionist caused frequent mix-ups in scheduling appointments.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his absentmindednesses, claiming he once tried to pay for groceries with a library card.
meanings.sent4: In the whirlwind of her absentmindednesses, it was as if her thoughts were dancing just out of reach.
meanings.sent5: The absentmindednesses of the child were like playful butterflies, flitting from one thought to the next.
